changesets.comments:
client: added latched flag to s_sdl cvars, new default for s_sdlSpeed,
useless if removed refs #96

client: s_sdlSpeed → s_khz, s_sdlBits → s_bits, s_sdlChannels →
s_channels refs #96

journals.notes: s_sdl vars changes only take effect when game is restarted (Similar to com_hunkmegs). Did add latched flags and set 22050 as default for s_sdlSpeed.

details.name: description
details.old_value:
Just to maintain compatibility with config menus and 2.6b players' configs.

s_sdlSpeed -> s_khz
s_sdlBits -> s_bits
s_sdlChannels -> s_channels
s_sdlMixSamps -> ?
s_sdlDevSamps -> ?
details.new_value:
Just to maintain compatibility with config menus and 2.6b players' configs.

Would be nice to have old cvars name as well:

s_sdlSpeed -> s_khz
s_sdlBits -> s_bits
s_sdlChannels -> s_channels
s_sdlMixSamps -> ?
s_sdlDevSamps -> ?

journals.notes:
IR4T4 wrote:
> s_sdl vars changes only take effect when game is restarted (Similar to com_hunkmegs). Did add latched flags and set 22050 as default for s_sdlSpeed.

Wouldn't it be - taking into account modern computers, which drastically differ from counterparts 10 and more years ago - better to change default to 44100? Should compose pretty nice together with ogg support :]

Better default for s_sdlSpedd (44100) already done with http://www.etlegacy.com/projects/etlegacy/repository/revisions/f8239ec6b4d0c4d44cf15a72d16762d766c35487

{TODO} review to use/remove old cvar names

Bump.

What about renaming cvars back to the vanilla names?

> s_sdlSpeed -> s_khz
> s_sdlBits -> s_bits
> s_sdlChannels -> s_channels
> s_sdlMixSamps -> ?
> s_sdlDevSamps -> ?
Renamed. s_sdlMixSamps and s_sdlDevSamps are SDL specific.

subject: Change SDL specific sound cvars back to default ones
description:
Just to maintain compatibility with config menus and 2.6b players' configs.

Would be nice to have old cvars names as well:

s_sdlSpeed -> s_khz
s_sdlBits -> s_bits
s_sdlChannels -> s_channels
s_sdlMixSamps -> ?
s_sdlDevSamps -> ?
